The girl who will never give up chasing theboy, and the boy who will never give up to avoid the girl. With a plot like a cul-de-sac, the repetitive story is not inevitable.But strangely, or perhaps incredibly, this anime does not automatically become boring. There is something that makes it quite unique compared to other harem anime genre, so we do not just say, "Ah, that here again ....". Perhaps because of the way to introduce the character of thegirls who walk backwards. Rather than bring them together with the main character Akito one by one in a most awkward situation, this anime directly collectthem around before then recounted their past to engage with Akito. Or maybe because the moments of romance that feels a little different. Doesnot mean completely new, but presented its own peculiar way. Or maybe it's comedy. Not the funniest, but still be able to make anyone smile amused. Although still far from being regarded as a good work, anime story is still capable of being entertaining interlude in the midst of busy.

Warning: This review is coming from someone who has probably watched a lot less anime than you. All the same, hope you find something in it :3
This is honestly the best romantic anime I've ever seen...yeah, if you look at my anime list there's not a whole lot to compare it to. But honestly this one blew me out of the water.
I feel the problem with a lot of ecchi (if this even counts as that) is that it will subordinate everything for the sake of fanservice. I'll admit, I was drawn towards this anime based on the fact that it was, yknow, hot -but I stayed for completely different reasons.


For a start the art is superb. Yeah, it's not too stylistic, but definitely not a rushed job either. The music was nice too (especially the closing song omg), but what this anime really has going for it is the characters.


Like, just to start, Akito's relations with the girls actually seem real enough for him not to want to go further with them. Like, he either has an obsessive sister, a pyschopath, his best friend, a nymphomaniac, a small girl or his boss XD It really sucks in harem anime where you're just like "Jesus Christ why are you not going for this girl?" The important thing to remember is that this anime doesn't exploit the idea of a brother-complex, but more so makes fun of it. Like, Akiko is annoying and dumb, but like, that's the whole point.


But all the girls themselves are pretty interesting. As far as I can tell none of them (except maybe Akiko) are too stereotypical. In fact if you look at it by the time you get halfway through the show isn't really about the incestuous relationship in the title. The best part of the whole series BY FAR has to be Gin's backstory with Akito, about the way the became friends. It was just so cute and funny and heartwarming and ugghghghghhg.


On top of that I thought the whole thing was genuinely funny. The humour wasn't confined to obvious "oops I slipped and landed on oni-chan's crotch" jokes; there was a good mix of funny animations and well written humour. Ana was particularly well done, being so deadpan and confusing really added something to the show.


Tbf the only negative things I would say are that the final episode didn't really wrap things up too well (though there might be second season?) and that it became a little bit fan-servicey at some points...just some angles left me thinking about how unnecessary they were.


SO, if you're looking for a lighthearted but well done romantic thing (and also don't mind the idea of incest) then I'd say definitely check this one out! :D

Some minor spoilers ahead:
Okay, I'm going to start off by saying this is my first review and I am only actually doing this because a lot of the other reviews are kind of harsh and don't take something into consideration. Now, I consider myself pretty open minded and watch a good amount of ecchii and harem comedies so its not like I get surprised very often, but this one did catch me off guard, in a good way.
*~Story~*: This...is pretty basic and bland for the majority of the series. Its so cookie cutter, I wouldn't normally consider giving this above a 6 usually and Iwould say other's reviews are justified, HOWEVER, this did something rather unique. You have the incestuous sister, 3 additional heroines who have no real story of showing up except to suddenly be there as a way to get into the sister's way of pursuing her forbidden love and eventually even the teacher who seems smitten for the MC for no other reason than she just has to be to lead him on a proper path. Jokes ensue and its really nothing special from whats ever been done before, except...the ending. The ending had a couple of hooks in it that I found very novel and I will admit I was surprised and didn't see them coming. You find out there ARE deeper motives to these girls that had supposedly just shown up and there is more to just falling for the MC just for the sake of plot. To me, the ending is a very integral part of the show, there have been very many that were fantastic and really superior only to drop the ball at the very end. This is a rare exception in where it did the total opposite. The ending actually redeemed the rest of the show, it made the previous 9 episodes or so of watching it worth it.


Story score: 8. I'd rate this higher if there was some notable things throughout the story, but as highly as I rate the ending its not everything, especially when you might lose most your audience before they even get to see it.


*~Art~*: This is cute. While its not spectacular by any means, nor does it particularly have anything to make it take itself serious or engaging, the characters themselves seem oddly disproportioned/designed. This isn't really a bad thing though, it really fits with the easy going nature of the show and are easy on the eyes. Each of the characters is distinct save the MC himself who is made so painstakingly generic it can only be done on purpose. 


Art score: 7


*~Sound*~: This is probably the weakest part of my review because if I am honest, I don't have much of an ear for music. That said, nothing stood out to me nor did anything particularly bother me, I didn't even think of it at all as I watched. Leavening me to say it left no impression either way.


Sound score: 7


*~Character~*: Okay, this is where a show like this is usually made or broken. I mentioned that many of the girls just pop up with no real purpose, love the MC for no real reason, and frankly are...very typical. There is nothing about them that should make this particularly stand out, however I don't want to give anything away, but the ending reveals a depth to them that is not at all apparent through the majority of the show. The are mainly eye candy and there to compromise the MC's standing with the little sister and pursue deviant like activities with the protagonist because...plot. The main issue I have is that there is no real depth or unique traits to any of the heroines unitl...said plot device happens. It actually happens so abruptly and without actual warning, I can't help but feel it was just kinda added as a last minute idea and as far as that goes it was a great one. The characters are mildly funny and each is great in the delivery of the role they portray keeping this rather simple and easy to enjoy


Character score: 7


*~Enjoyment~*: This is a very simple comedy/ecchii, you don't have to think too hard about. Its not going to really stand out as a great title, but its something that is a nice break when you are on a horror/suspense binge or perhaps just need a comedy with a bit of sex appeal to it. I personally like titles like this since I am all over the board with what I watch, and some shows can be very emotionally draining, so a simple comedy with pretty girls to look at is nice. I know I keep harping on it, but I was floored by the ending. As someone that watches a lot of ecchii/comedy/harems and still being took by surprise was quite novel, and I enjoyed the reason behind the girls that much. As pointless as it started out to be, the ending gives you a very good clean up of it, but only if you're the type that will be patient to get that far in the series.


Enjoyment score: 8


Overall: I gave it an 8. Many people are right, this show is pretty lack luster, but its simple and you can turn your brain off for it. Its not something I'm gonna say people need to rush to go see, however, it offers a unique take on the harem genre I found refreshing. So much so I at least decided it didn't deserve all the harshness a majority of the reviews say. You won't be missing much by passing on this, but I can't help that this title got wasted somewhat. That ending brought together such an intriguing plotline to it, it feels like the mediocrity that lead up to it doesn't do it justice and that with better planning or story management, this could have been a very epic anime in its own right. Sadly, one great idea is useless when nobody will get to the point to appreciate it because of tedious/poor lead up.


If you want ecchii/comedies that might stand out because of being slightly beyond the norm and have better story throughout, I suggest to try

Rokujouma no Shinryakusha or Boku Ha Tomodachi Ga Sukunai

OniAi is a well-made ecchi harem comedy. OniAi tells the story of Himenokouji Akito, a regular and responsible young man, hoping to live a regular and responsible life, whose younger sister, Himenokouji Akiko (the two having names that are a single letter apart can create confusion but it's a minor complain) is highly incestuous, demanding that Akito does some romantic thing with her at any given time. Other members of the harem which Akito does not acknowledge or recognise the existence of include his tomboyish childhood friend, seito kaichou and sexual predator as well as the ojou-sama who acts more unlike one than any othercharacter.


OniAi is, above all else, a comedy, where the writing is of utmost importance. Fortunately for OniAi, this is where it shines. Whilst there are definitely better examples of writing in a comedy out there, OniAi has strong writing, and the comedy is strong and consistent, and while some episodes do appear to have prioritisation of the ecchi over the comedy, it still remains solid throughout, with no significantly bad episodes or parts.


At the end of the day, OniAi is a good watch. The humour and characters are good, the animation is well-done, and the interactions between the characters, especially those with Akiko never fall short. It's not groundbreaking, but it's definitely not bad. I'd recommend OniAi any day of the week.

This is probably the most enjoyable ecchi/harem/comedy anime i have ever seen besides to love ru. Yes it is cliche after all it is a harem show but yet it is still very good. One of the reasons that this anime is so good is because of the MC. That dude is the definiton of self control. He is not a pussy like Rito from to love ru nor is he a complete pervert like Issei from High school DXD. Basically his character is just really likeable.
Another character that is just so loveable is his cute little imouto Akiko. If brocon of the year awardwas a real thing then she would win for sure. Her obsession with her older brother is just hilarious. Now i will say that this anime is sorely lacking in the character development department. Yes i know it is short and that there is only so much you can do with 12 episodes however i expected more character development. I will say though that there are some backstories in the second half of the show which gives some depth to the characters, but its not really enough.\n\n
So should you watch this? I would say yes if you like comedy ecchi animes. This is only my personal opinion but OniAi is my second favorite ecchi/comedy/harem anime. Dont take the anime too seriously, just sit back, relax and enjoy.

There are a lot of anime where a male MC has a little sister. This one, however, has a female MC having a big brother. That's right, the roles are reversed as this series tackles more on the female's perspective and does it in a hilarious manner.
In regards to plot... There's no plot. It's just one of those anime which would've been better as an OVA. But still, it's interesting to see why the little sister of the series is so obsessed with her brother.
Characters are... disposable. The MC is your typical ecchi/harem MC surrounded by beautiful girls who all want a shot at him.Also, the little sister resembled the heroine from Sankarea. Not really original, in my opinion. There is, however, one character that I personally liked: Anastasia. Now she's a character who's hard to define. She's not a kuudere because she sometimes act like a tsundere who is also quite perverted.\n\n
The art style was... okay. The opening theme was hilarious and the ending theme was cute.\n\n
Was it enjoyable? Yes, it was funny. And if I weren't a harsh critic, I would've given this anime a higher score. But since I've seen a lot of anime with similar themes, it doesn't seem that surprising. I'd recommend these to those new to anime, and also those who want a bit of laugh. In the end, it doesn't really matter who the brother ends up with.

If you have a sister near the age of yourself this may uninterest you. But it's a funny harem anime. however there is a brother-loving female character that may be the deciding factor for most potential viewers. So Far So Good

Onii-chan Dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne is fun and weird anime. Onii-chan Dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne is a harem that's basically it but the thing is the main character doesn't love the girls back. I found it fun at some points and dull at some point. my main dislike about it is that the character design is a basic harem you have a friend, a foreigner, a sister, and a senior at the school. What I think could have made it better if they made the girls background a little better then the regular harem background. But there not tosay there isn't good parts. Some of the best parts where the weird scene where one girl want to have sex with him but he always fights his way out in a funny way that ends with someone finding them in a weird way that is totally not what he was trying to do. So I would recommend Onii-chan Dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne to some of my anime friends the ones that like a regular harem.

Onii-chan dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne! is the generic of generic harem rom coms, with brocon thrown in. Ill start by saying I did not enjoy this anime, and i only watched it for the female heroine, Akiko. But some people enjoyed it so i guess you might like it? Lets see.
Story-3/10
Normally. i would give stories like this a 1/10. But harems don't need a good story. Basically, a brother lives in a house with a bunch of girls and his sister that all have the hots for him, and they get in all these ecchi situations. Basics of the basics.
Art-7/10
Didn't wow me,but it was good. The art alone isn't worth watching this by a long shot.


Sound-7/10

It was good.


Character-3/10

Ill start of by saying any characters besides Akiko are generic as hell. Not memorable, and for the most part, not really likable either. I found myself getting annoyed at them most of the time. ESPECIALLY the male protagonist. He is the nicest of harem males, the mormon at your school, or the neighbour you figured was too nice. He reacts very poorly to the ecchi situations and acts so disinterested in love, and dense that he takes my spot for the worst harem male lead ever. Akiko is what lifts the heavy anchor to a 3/10 instead of a 1/10. She unlike the others, is original, cute and very likable, the saving grace of the show. She was the only reason i kept watching, but i was also hoping to see a payoff, a scene where she gets to have beautiful romance with her brother. Unfortunately, that NEVER happens, the most you get is a cute scene, no kissing or any real ecchi moments between them that are worthwhile. Overall, everyone is poor besides Akiko.


Enjoyment-3/10

I said before, i did not enjoy the anime. The characters are the worst part of the anime, and it's also the most important really. Without good characters, i don't really see this worth watching. Akiko is the only reason and probably isn't enough. The ecchi situations are generic, and only a few were good. I found myself getting annoyed frequently, and there is no real strong climax of the series. Quite lackluster really.


Overall-3/10

I didn't like this anime. The characters were weak and the whole thing was very generic. Akiko for me, is the only reason you could watch the show, otherwise stay away. The brotherly love is meh however. If you want more intimate brocon, watch Kissxsis. If you want more romantic brocon, watch Oriemo. While i didn't like the rest of the characters, others might and so if you like generic characters with brocon thrown in you may like this generic harem.

The art style is spot on, I normally pick my animes based on if I think the art will entice me, however the art style could not save itself. I just felt that this anime was totally cringe worthy. I could only make it to episode two. I looked up the synopsis of this anime, and that couldn't lure me in. The whole incestuous nature of this anime stressed me out for obvious reasons. like I said I know what happens so I won't post any spoilers like so many already have so i suggest either reading those or googling a quick summary before youwaste your precious time trying to decide if you'll like this anime or not.


Many of you may enjoy it, but safe to say I most certainly couldn't get into it.


to each their own i suppose.

I gave this a 4/10.
+ Okay animation quality, looks clean.
+ I like Nasuhara-san.
+ Some funny moments here and there.
+/- Music/OST is nothing special.
+/- Seems to have a really hard time deciding between censoring or not censoring the nipples on tiddies.
- The little sister trope this anime is built around gets old very fast (believe me, you don't want to hear the word "imouto" for a while after watching this).
- MC is the usual bland, generic and incidentally super dense harem protagonist practically drowning in you know what. Makes you wonder what the girls even see in this poker face machine.
- No other interesting characters besidesNasuhara-san (the blond girl).\n
- Harmless joking aside, I personally do not really warm up to incestuous relationships.\n\n
Overall a below average harem piece in my opinion. Nasuhara did make me laugh though^^

***This review may contain information that might be regarded as mild spoilers***
Well now there are many ways to approach this anime review. I could review it based solely on the anime or I could compare it to the light novel and inform you what was lost in the “translation”. For the sake of giving the anime a fair shot, I will score it based only on the anime itself but I will be injecting notes on what the anime could have done better in comparison to the light novel.
Story: 4/10
So the anime does a pretty piss poor job of explaining what is going on andkeeping your feelings invested towards the characters. The plot is essentially a reuniting of Akito and his sister Akiko after a long separation. They end up living in the same house along with the student council at their high school and the usually boy x girl events happen. The anime unfortunately comes across as a generic harem while the light novel feels more like a serious drama. The anime has all the typical harem scenes that we have experienced in the past; the shower scene, the mall scene, ext. I hate to say it but the anime really looks and feels as if it was put together very half-hazardly and was trying to ride on the success of the light novel. Please understand that this is NOT a faithful adaptation of the light novel.


Animation 6/10


The animation is somewhat a mixed bag; it looks great in some scenes but the overall quality is somewhat lower than what I would expect from a 2012 anime. The characters are visually appealing but the show lacks a certain visual aspect that sets itself apart from all the other anime. This lighting is not done very well, you see many instances where proportions do not really match up, ext. The animation just comes off as generic for eighty percent of the time.


Sound: 7/10


The only redeeming quality for this anime in the sound department are the voice actors’ performances. Each character’s voice actor did a superb job injecting their feelings into their characters. Anastasia has a cold, monotone personality that is expressed well by her voice actor. Even the annoying but too cute Akiko’s voice actor did an amazing job making Akiko a loved and disliked character. Other than the voice acting though the anime falls pretty low on the bar as far as sound goes. The background music is forgettable and generic but the intro and ending songs are quite catchy.


Characters: 7/10


The cast of this anime work very well with each other even if most of them are forgettable. Akito, Akiko, and Anastasia were for me the stars of the show. Akito’s strong will and intellect, Akiko’s annoying but super cute personality, and Anastasia’s cold and cool attitude created so many funny and unique scenes throughout the entire anime. My personal favorite character was Anastasia because even though her personality withheld most of her true feelings from everyone else, it was easy to always tell what was on her mind. Also her interactions with Akito were the most fun to watch. The other characters however were either boring or just not appealing. I especially found Arashi just out of place and a bother to the whole chemistry of the group. The young house leader was also quite annoying and off putting. Overall the main three characters really helps make the show shine but a couple others bring it back down.


Overall: 6/10


Overall the anime adaptation of Onii-chan Dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne (what a mouthful) is just generic. After reading some of the light novel a couple months before the airing of the anime, I was very excited to see the brother sister romance issue unfold with the student council. What unfortunately occurred here was taking a great drama with very thought provoking and witty conversations and turning it into another generic and barely passable harem anime. I advise that you steer clear from the anime and just read the light novel. It is much better than the anime and it will have you craving for more.


Enjoyment: 5/10

I don't care about incest, harems, fan service, lolis, or any other crap: what I want is a funny show that entertains me to the point I forget how shit IRL is. Anything else is a pleasant bonus surprise. Oniichan makes two critical mistakes that prevent it from being interesting:
1) It's not lewd enough
2) The entire point of the series gets boring about halfway through
As for the first point, even watching the uncensored version there weren't enough lewd moments to keep my interest, and because of the second point I actually began to nod off during the last couple episodes. I really don't know whyI kept on with it, except maybe avoiding work or the fact I was generally starving for harems.\n\n
Series like DxD or Monmusu maintain their lewdity from start to finish and also have good stories to tell while there aren't cartoon tiddies flopping back and forth. It's fun to stay involved in both senses. Oniichan doesn't have consistent fan service and the "slice of life" feel it tries hard to maintain doesn't present any interesting scenarios. There's a bikini judging contest towards the end of the series that was so utterly boring I don't think it could have been done any worse even if there was a free-entry contest called "design the worst bikini judging contest and win five billion dollarioos." The last couple episodes are also quite heavy on flashbacks, and those aren't interesting either because I couldn't have given less of a fuck how these people met as kids since I just watched ten episodes of them being friends already. \n\n
The spicy incest angle is also boring to watch because the brother never once slips up in refusing advances and the sister is obnoxious in all ways. She isn't sexy or alluring or possessing of a funny, witty personality: she's a bratty bitch who never stops whining about everything. Supporting characters in the "harem" (it's weak and nothing at all like DxD, etc) have various angles to them but no depth to speak of. I also think the legitimate loli was gross, although maybe that's just my puritanical upbringing clawing its way through my adult facade.\n\n
Why not a 1? Because I still finished it. The premise was decent, and what little lewd scenes there were at least made me pay attention. I don't particularly regret watching either, but I definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone else unless you're like me and just about out of new harem shows that actually have some "plot" to them.
